channel.title: Shreyas Korad — Writing

item.title: Designing manager-led learning loops that change decisions (edition 775)

item.title: We are becoming too used to the shortest feedback loop
item.description: We are becoming too used to the shortest feedback loop discusses data‑backed strategies for embedding learning in daily workflows, boosting performance and judgment.

item.title: AI workflow metrics for L&D teams
item.description: AI workflow metrics for L&D teams is most credible when it improves how teams decide, align, and follow through in everyday execution.

item.title: AI-assisted learning design must preserve human judgment
item.description: Learning design teams should treat AI as a decision amplifier not a decision-maker. This framing matters because AI speeds iteration but cannot replace the nuanced judgment needed for effective learning experiences.

item.title: How managers coach decision quality without courses
item.description: Move beyond generic feedback to daily coaching that builds measurable judgment, not completion tracking.

item.description: Embed learning into existing team rhythms to scale knowledge without adding meetings.

item.title: Build a practical LXD workflow for small teams shipping weekly
item.description: Build a practical LXD workflow for small teams shipping weekly gets real traction when teams tie it to one recurring decision and review what changed in the next cycle.
